title: Rugby world cup: Fans charged £3k a NIGHT to stay in Cardiff through Air BnB
text:
Rugby world cup: Fans charged £3k a NIGHT to stay in Cardiff through Air BnB Rugby world cup: Fans charged £3k a NIGHT to stay in Cardiff through Air BnB Savvy home owners in Cardiff are cashing in on the rugby world - and the city's lack of accommodation - to charge visitors thousands of pounds to stay on a sofa bed for the night. PUBLISHED: 12:35, Mon, Oct 12, 2015 | UPDATED: 13:57, Mon, Oct 12, 2015 GETTY New Zealand fans could be left out pocket by accommodation costs 
Residents have spotted the opportunity to make a swift buck, as hotels in the Welsh city struggle to meet the demand from Rugby fans who want to stay over after watching games at the Millennium stadium. Through home-sharing site Air BnB, tourists are now being offered a place to stay at a nightly rate higher than some of the world's poshest hotels - and travellers who leave accommodation bookings to the last minute are unlikely to have many other options. 
Ahead of this Saturday's match between New Zealand and France, and Sunday's game between Ireland and Argentina, Cardiff's Travelodges and Holiday Inns are completely sold out this weekend. Air BnB is typically supposed to offer travellers a cheaper alternative than local hotels, but this Saturday guests are instead being offered a three-bedroom terrace in the city, at a rate of £3,002 a night - plus an additional £200 service fee. Air BnB A bedroom in a home offered for £3,002 a night in Cardiff Air BnB Guests are being asked to pay an eye-watering £3,002 a night - plus service The Ritz A two-bedroom suite at the Ritz costs £2,000 a night Related articles Wales ready for Rugby World Cup quarter-final tie with South... 
In return for the hefty price, visitors get two double beds, plus a single bed, and a 20 minute walk to the Millennium Stadium. The rate is around 50 per cent higher than one of the top rates charged by London's Ritz, where guests pay £2,000 a night for a plush two bedroom suite and breakfast in the grand hotel. Alternative Air BnB options in Cardiff for this Saturday include a small studio flat on offer at £2,000 a night, which features one bed plus a sofa bed, or £651 for just a room in a terraced home. The site said that the number of homes being listed by Cardiff residents has jumped by more than 500 per cent from this time last year. Air BnB This studio flat in Cardiff is being offered at £1,000 a night i 
James McClure, UK country manager Airbnb, said: "We find that big sporting events like this are a huge draw for people to start sharing their homes on Airbnb. "Not only do they allow residents to make valuable extra income around that time, our hosts tell us that one of the biggest benefits they experience is the people they meet and the connections they forge. "It's great to see the UK embracing home-sharing to welcome rugby fans from all around the world; I'm sure there will be some interesting spectatorship in living rooms up and down the country!"
